intro: Saussurea acutisquama, commonly known as the narrow-leaved yarrow, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in alpine and arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellowish-white in color. Saussurea acutisquama is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
